The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with elongated, ribbon-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, providing protection against harsh weather conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Zosterophyllanthos oxapampae is considered a species of conservation concern.
